Introduction

Introduction

Deligence Technologies offers Salesforce application development services to empower businesses to streamline their sales, marketing, and customer service processes beyond the capabilities of the standard Salesforce CRM. With extensive experience in CRM development dating back to 2014, Deligence Technologies can create customized Salesforce applications, including both custom apps and AppExchange apps, specifically designed to address your unique business needs.

Types of Salesforce Apps We Build

Types of Salesforce Apps We Build

We create robust and flawless Salesforce applications that empower our clients to optimize their sales, marketing, and customer service operations. Our expertise extends to developing popular applications that garner a wide user base and achieve top rankings on the AppExchange marketplace.

Custom apps for internal needs

  • Salesforce provides two categories of applications: intricate apps and streamlined apps. Intricate apps are tailored to enhance Salesforce's capabilities and cater to the demands of refining or revolutionizing internal business processes that go beyond the scope of standard CRM functionality.
  • Instances of intricate apps encompass property management and delivery planning applications.
  • Streamlined apps are crafted to address a specific set of tasks within Salesforce, including document generation and lead assignment.

Apps for AppExchange

  • Salesforce applications fall into two primary categories: applications developed for publication on AppExchange as independent revenue streams and applications tailored to integrate a company's external products, such as cloud platforms or web applications, into the Salesforce ecosystem.

Full-Cycle Salesforce Development Services

Full-Cycle Salesforce Development Services

Business Requirements or Analysis

Business analysis is the foundation of creating a custom application for internal use. It involves gathering requirements from stakeholders, prioritizing them, and presenting them in a detailed report. Our business analysts can stay in touch with customers throughout the project to ensure that requirements are met.

Requirements analysis is also the first step in building an application for the Salesforce AppExchange. We analyze customer requirements, check for consistency, elaborate on them, and devise efficient ways to meet them with technical means. This helps us to create applications that are efficient and compliant with Salesforce system and security standards.

UI/UX design

We create user-friendly and responsive Salesforce applications by mapping out user journeys and creating UI prototypes.

This means that we first understand how users will interact with the application, and then we design the application's interface to be easy to use and responsive to different devices and screen sizes.

Development

We develop feature-rich applications in small increments, prioritizing features based on their importance. To maintain agility and respond promptly to evolving customer needs, we first create a functional baseline. We can then quickly deliver additional features based on requests from end users or product owners. This enables users to start using the application as soon as possible and take advantage of new features shortly after they are released (for custom applications developed for internal use, new features are typically added every 2-4 weeks following the baseline's release).

For small applications, we provide a rapid, one-time delivery approach tailored to the application's size and purpose.

Quality assurance

We employ a comprehensive suite of quality assurance (QA) measures to guarantee the high quality and stability of our Salesforce applications. These measures include unit tests and code reviews conducted by Salesforce developers. We integrate continuous testing activities into the development process, encompassing functional testing, performance testing, and integration testing as required. Additionally, we leverage an appropriate degree of test automation to expedite application delivery and minimize the number of bugs.

Necessary integrations

To integrate custom applications for internal use with third-party software, such as content management systems, we utilize either Salesforce's native integration tools or tailor-made integration tools developed from scratch.

User training

We enhance user adoption of custom applications for internal use by creating comprehensive training materials and conducting hands-on training sessions for end users.

Launch

For custom applications intended for internal use, we deploy the thoroughly tested application to the UAT (User Acceptance Testing) environment. Upon the customer's approval, the application is migrated to the production environment and made accessible to end-users.

When launching an application on the AppExchange, we prepare it for the AppExchange security review. This involves creating comprehensive documentation for both end-users and administrators, which is then submitted to the Salesforce Product Security Team. Additionally, we provide credentials for the Lightning Platform org and any external components or services employed in the application's development.

After-launch support

We provide ongoing support for custom applications for internal use for 1-3 months following their launch. During this period, we refine the application's features and implement measures to promote user adoption beyond initial training. This includes providing release notes and promptly addressing user concerns.
